critique: This document pertains to employment and compensation within the Canal Zone in 1950. It suspends certain provisions of the General Appropriation Act of 1951, but maintains compensation limits for specific positions. Given the historical context and the specific nature of the document, assessing its position on the traditional left-right political spectrum is difficult. The document suspends certain provisions of an act, which could be interpreted as an expansion of executive power, although it's a targeted suspension.
